page.title: 08The Shop
page.content: There used to be three village shops. Now there is only one. The present shop has been there for over eighty years. The building itself is two hundred years old. Previously it was a doctor's room and two cottages. The present shopkeeper has only lived in Cromhall since 1984. Although she has quite a lot of customers, she could do with even more local support. Most of her customers are women and children. However, many local people use supermarkets in nearby towns. She provides a more friendly and personal service. The average amount spent is between Â£5 and Â£10. She sells a wide range of groceries and vegetables. The most popular sweets seem to be Mars bars and Yorkies.
